problem_text: G R I D I N In the figure, the radius of circle A is twice the radius of circle B and four times the radius of circle C. If the sum of the circumferences of the three circles is 42 \pi, find the measure of A C.
compact_text: GRIDINIn the figure, the radius of circle A is twice the radius of circle B and four times the radius of circle C. If the sum of the circumferences of the three circles is 42\pi, find the measure of AC.
annotat_text: GRID IN In the figure, the radius of circle $A$ is twice the radius of circle $B$ and four times the radius of circle $C .$ If the sum of the circumferences of the three circles is $42 \pi,$ find the measure of $\overline{A C}$
